## VectorBuilder.combine() method

Constructs a vector by combining the values of two other vectors

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
combine(first: Vector<S>, second: Vector<S>, combineEntries: (a: S, b: S) => S): Vector<S>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  first | <code>Vector&lt;S&gt;</code> | The first vector to combine |
|  second | <code>Vector&lt;S&gt;</code> | The second vector to combine |
|  combineEntries | <code>(a: S, b: S) =&gt; S</code> | A function which takes an entry from each vector and returns a new entry |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Vector<S>`

The new vector

## Example


```
const first = vec([1, 2, 3]);
const second = vec([2, 3, 4]);

const combined = combine(first, second, (a,b) => a * b);
// [2, 6, 12]

```
